Detailed Description

The network service functions use the Berkeley socket model to do network I/O using TCP and UDP. For non-blocking I/O, the "event" model described in Timer and asynchronous I/O services (IPDR_RegisterReadSocket_t, :IPDRRegisterWriteSocket_t) allows a callback style of programming, which will also work for the WinSock model.

All the network functions expect the address and port parameters to be in host order and not in network order.

Typedef Documentation

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_Bind_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle S, IPDR_IPAddress LocalAddr, unsigned short LocalPort)
 

Bind a socket to a local address.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
S Socket (created with IPDR_CreateTCPSocket_t or IPDR_CreateUDPSocket_t).
LocalAddr The local address in host byte order. If this value is #IPDR_LOCAL_ADDRESS, use the address of the transmitter (client) machine (i.e., equivalent to 127.0.0.1)
LocalPort the local port number in host byte order.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_ERR_ADDRESS_ALREADY_IN_USE, IPDR_ERR_COMMUNICATION_ERROR, or IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_Close_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle S)
 

Close a socket and deallocate any resources associated with the socket. If you need to leave the socket allocated, use IPDR_Shutdown_t.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
S Socket (created with IPDR_CreateTCPSocket_t or IPDR_CreateUDPSocket_t).
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_CreateTCPSocket_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle *S)
 

Create a socket that can be used for TCP communication.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
S (output) Identifier of the newly created socket.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_CreateUDPSocket_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle *S)
 

Create a socket that can be used for UDP communication.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
S (output) Identifier of the newly created socket.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_GetSockName_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle S, IPDR_IPAddress *LocalAddr, unsigned short *LocalPort)
 

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_Shutdown_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle S)
 

Shutdown a socket for both reading and writing, leaving the socket allocated. The socket is still allocated, but any operation other than IPDR_Close_t will get an error status.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
S Socket (created with IPDR_CreateTCPSocket_t or IPDR_CreateUDPSocket_t).
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
